conversations.content: Reckless Flames: Part One
The young flame dragon ran out of breath and fell to the ground.
The fallen dragon was immediately buffeted by a heat he had never before known. And within that fire stood an impassive Flamewyrm.
＂Ah, the vagaries of youth,＂ said the Flamewyrm. ＂Alas, your flames were but the nibbling of a mosquito when compared to my own majesty.＂
＂If you wish to fell me, you must first become the most powerful dragon in all the world,＂ continued the Flamewyrm before taking wing and soaring off into the sky.
The young dragon stared after the Flamewyrm as she disappeared into the distance. He felt indignation, yes, but more than that, he yearned to become stronger.
The immature dragon acknowledged his own weakness and swore to become the most powerful dragon ever, that he might stand proudly before the Flamewyrm once more.
Thus did the young wyrm begin to travel the world, seeking strength wherever it might be found.
He razed a hundred kingdoms with his flames, and earned the moniker of ＂Blazewyrm＂ for his actions.
Yet he still lacked ultimate strength, and knew he could not yet stand before the Flamewyrm again.
And so, he paid visit to a certain dragon...
The elder of all dragons: the Holywyrm Elysium.
The young seeker gave all he had to the challenge. And...
Reckless Flames: Part Two
Driven by desire for strength like the Flamewyrm's, the Blazewyrm sought the title of strongest dragon in the world. And so, he challenged the Holywyrm Elysium.
The result was pitiful: The Blazewyrm could not land even a single blow upon the elder of all dragons.
He despaired that the title of the  strongest would always be beyond him. For despite his power, he had been naught but a child's toy to the Holywyrm.
Soon, his dissolute heart drove him to rampage across the countryside, destroying all he could see. But then, a man appeared before him.
This man was a prince of Alberia, and he had modified the dragon under his command with alchemy.
Alchemy was forbidden to dragons. The Blazewyrm felt disgust at the breaking of this grotesque taboo, and instantly attacked the twisted creature the man had created.
He battled the dragon and won. But there was no joy in victory, for his opponent had been a lowly dragon without pride or strength of its own.
Yet the Blazewyrm was wounded due to the power of alchemy. When he realized this, a lust for that forbidden power rose up within him.
The man praised the Blazewyrm's strength and pressed him to forge a new pact.
This arrogant man sought to take back the world from dragons, and the Blazewyrm could see he was prepared to use any and all means to see that goal realized.
Even the most forbidden of taboos was nothing to this man—yet the Blazewyrm saw that avariciousness as a ray of hope that would lift him toward his ultimate goal.
Finally, he swallowed his loathing at the thought of alchemy and proffered a single outstretched wing to the man.
Thus was the pact forged, and the forbidden alchemical process begun soon thereafter.
As loathing gnawed at his heart for having broken the taboo, he recalled the Flamewyrm.
He realized that even if he stood before her now, it would be as a sick and twisted being with a mind that was no longer his own. It was...most regrettable.
